Description: Three large fragments probably from the knee area of a tunic (front and back); Undyed, unbleached plain weave, linen with composite self-bands each fragment also having a small tapestry (on grouped warp threads) medallion in wool and linen with the same design: a naked figure standing in a two-branched flowering tree, under the tree two goats reaching up to eat it; Multicoloured on a red ground, black outlines, wave border (on 13 ii + 14), a brocaded straight red line (marker?); Warp: linen, S spun, c.21 tpc; Weft: linen and wool S spun, c.21 tpc in plain areas, c.50 in tapestry; Edges: three sections of plain selvedge (two probably the same), on (14) a warp fringe, other edges hidden (in seam) or fragmentary; Sewing: on (13i), part of a side seam, run and fell, in S spun Z ply linen thread.
Curator's comments: Previous location cupboard 64, red box; if from a tunic the selvedges would have formed the hem of the garment, the seam on (13i) would have been part of a side seam. Information from Hero Grangler-Taylor (24.5.1990)
Condition: Mixed, in places good, colour good. At date unknown stuck to sticky net.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
